segments.en: Numbered Discourses 8
4. Giving
35. Rebirth by Giving
“Mendicants, there are these eight rebirths by giving.
What eight?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco dānaṃ deti samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā annaṃ pānaṃ vatthaṃ yānaṃ mālāgandhavilepanaṃ seyyāvasathapadīpeyyaṃ.
segments.en: First, someone gives to ascetics or brahmins such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, fragrance, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.
Whatever they give, they expect something back.

segments.pli: So passati khattiyamahāsāle vā brāhmaṇamahāsāle vā gahapatimahāsāle vā pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappite samaṅgībhūte paricārayamāne.
segments.en: They see a well-to-do aristocrat or brahmin or householder amusing themselves, supplied and provided with the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
It occurs to them:

segments.pli: ‘aho vatāhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā khattiyamahāsālānaṃ vā brāhmaṇamahāsālānaṃ vā gahapatimahāsālānaṃ vā sahabyataṃ upapajjeyyan’ti.
segments.en: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of well-to-do aristocrats or brahmins or householders!’

segments.pli: So taṃ cittaṃ dahati, taṃ cittaṃ adhiṭṭhāti, taṃ cittaṃ bhāveti.
segments.en: They settle on that idea, concentrate on it and develop it.

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ cittaṃ hīne vimuttaṃ, uttari abhāvitaṃ, tatrūpapattiyā saṃvattati.
segments.en: As they’ve settled for less and not developed further, their idea leads to rebirth there.

segments.pli: Kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā khattiyamahāsālānaṃ vā brāhmaṇamahāsālānaṃ vā gahapatimahāsālānaṃ vā sahabyataṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of well-to-do aristocrats or brahmins or householders.

segments.pli: Tañca kho sīlavato vadāmi, no dussīlassa.
segments.en: But I say that this is only for those of ethical conduct, not for the unethical.
The heart’s wish of an ethical person succeeds because of their purity.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco dānaṃ deti samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā annaṃ pānaṃ vatthaṃ yānaṃ mālāgandhavilepanaṃ seyyāvasathapadīpeyyaṃ.
segments.en: Next, someone gives to ascetics or brahmins …
Whatever they give, they expect something back.
And they’ve heard:
‘The Gods of the Four Great Kings are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
It occurs to them:

segments.pli: ‘aho vatāhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā cātumahārājikānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyyan’ti.
segments.en: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the Gods of the Four Great Kings!’ …

segments.pli: So taṃ cittaṃ dahati, taṃ cittaṃ adhiṭṭhāti, taṃ cittaṃ bhāveti.
Tassa taṃ cittaṃ hīne vimuttaṃ, uttari abhāvitaṃ, tatrūpapattiyā saṃvattati.
Kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā cātumahārājikānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the Gods of the Four Great Kings.

segments.pli: Tañca kho sīlavato vadāmi, no dussīlassa.
segments.en: But I say that this is only for those of ethical conduct, not for the unethical.
The heart’s wish of an ethical person succeeds because of their purity.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco dānaṃ deti samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā annaṃ pānaṃ vatthaṃ yānaṃ mālāgandhavilepanaṃ seyyāvasathapadīpeyyaṃ.
segments.en: Next, someone gives to ascetics or brahmins …
Whatever they give, they expect something back.
And they’ve heard:
‘The Gods of the Thirty-Three …’
‘The Gods of Yama …’
‘The Joyful Gods …’
‘The Gods Who Love to Create …’
‘The Gods Who Control the Creations of Others are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
It occurs to them:

segments.pli: ‘aho vatāhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā paranimmitavasavattīnaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyyan’ti.
segments.en: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the Gods Who Control the Creations of Others!’

segments.pli: So taṃ cittaṃ dahati, taṃ cittaṃ adhiṭṭhāti, taṃ cittaṃ bhāveti.
segments.en: They settle on that idea, concentrate on it and develop it.

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ cittaṃ hīne vimuttaṃ, uttari abhāvitaṃ, tatrūpapattiyā saṃvattati.
segments.en: As they’ve settled for less and not developed further, their idea leads to rebirth there.

segments.pli: Kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā paranimmitavasavattīnaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the Gods Who Control the Creations of Others.

segments.pli: Tañca kho sīlavato vadāmi, no dussīlassa.
segments.en: But I say that this is only for those of ethical conduct, not for the unethical.
The heart’s wish of an ethical person succeeds because of their purity.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco dānaṃ deti samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā annaṃ pānaṃ vatthaṃ yānaṃ mālāgandhavilepanaṃ seyyāvasathapadīpeyyaṃ.
segments.en: Next, someone gives to ascetics or brahmins such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, fragrance, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.
Whatever they give, they expect something back.
And they’ve heard:
‘The Gods of Brahmā’s Host are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
It occurs to them:

segments.pli: ‘aho vatāhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā brahmakāyikānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyyan’ti.
segments.en: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the Gods of Brahmā’s Host!’

segments.pli: So taṃ cittaṃ dahati, taṃ cittaṃ adhiṭṭhāti, taṃ cittaṃ bhāveti.
segments.en: They settle on that idea, concentrate on it and develop it.

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ cittaṃ hīne vimuttaṃ, uttari abhāvitaṃ, tatrūpapattiyā saṃvattati.
segments.en: As they’ve settled for less and not developed further, their idea leads to rebirth there.

segments.pli: Kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā brahmakāyikānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the Gods of Brahmā’s Host.

segments.pli: Tañca kho sīlavato vadāmi, no dussīlassa;
segments.en: But I say that this is only for those of ethical conduct, not for the unethical.
And for those free of desire, not those with desire.
The heart’s wish of an ethical person succeeds because of their freedom from desire.
These are the eight rebirths by giving.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, there are these eight rebirths by giving.

suttaplex.blurb: When giving, if you expect a certain result in the next life, you can get it, if the conditions are right.
